summary: About 500,000 postal retirees receive retiree health benefits. The Postal Service Retiree Health Benefits Fund pays most of the costs. The Postal Service has not made $38.2 billion in required payments to this fund through fiscal year 2017. If it makes no more payments, the Office of Personnel Management projects the fund will be depleted in fiscal year 2030. We highlighted several approaches to address...
title: Postal Retiree Health Benefits: Unsustainable Finances Need to Be Addressed
